issues.description: The UML in the problem statement declares RollerCoaster.numberOfLoopings as type int, but the solution implementation declares numberOfLoopings as double (with a RollerCoaster constructor taking a double). This creates a type mismatch between the specification and the reference implementation and can confuse students about the intended type (and cause test/compatibility issues).
issues.suggested_fix: Align the type of numberOfLoopings across artifacts. Preferably change the solution to use int for numberOfLoopings (attribute, RollerCoaster constructor parameter and getter return type) so it matches the UML/specification. Alternatively, if double is intended, update the UML/problem statement to specify double instead of int and adjust the task descriptions accordingly.
